Field Detail

reportBuilder

protected ReportBuilder reportBuilder
The report builder that created this target

ligretoNode

protected LigretoNode ligretoNode
The parent node from the XML file for reference to other objects.

columnStep

protected int columnStep
The number of columns to shift right after the call to setColumn.

baseRowNumber

protected int baseRowNumber
The base row which is defined by the call to getTargetBuilder. The numbering starts from 0.

baseColumnPosition

protected int baseColumnPosition
The base column which is defined by the call to getTargetBuilder. The numbering starts from 0.

currentRowNumber

protected int currentRowNumber
The actual row number where the output is being produced.

Initially this starts one row before the base row as this will get shifted by the call to nextRow

currentColumnPosition

protected int currentColumnPosition
The actual column number where the output is produced. The exact column number where the function setColumn stores the content is produced by taking this actCol value and adding the value of the column number argument specified in the setColumn method call.

ligretoParameters

protected LigretoParameters ligretoParameters
The global ligreto parameters.

Instances should be created by static methods.

Method Detail

dumpCell

public void dumpCell(int i,
                     java.lang.Object value)
              throws LigretoException
Description copied from interface: TargetInterface
Dump the specified object to the position shifted by the specified index. The position is adjusted by the step specified in the call to TargetInterface.setPosition(int, int) or TargetInterface.shiftPosition(int, int) and multiplied by the value of parameter index.

Specified by:
dumpCell in interface TargetInterface
Parameters:
i - the index of the output cell measured by the actual possition in the current row
value - the value to be dumped
Throws:
LigretoException - if there was processing error
See Also:
TargetInterface.setPosition(int, int), TargetInterface.shiftPosition(int, int)

setPosition

setPosition

public void setPosition(int columnPosition,
                        int columnStep)
Description copied from interface: TargetInterface
Sets up the output cell position within the current row. This method could be used to arrange the dump of values to be interlaced. This could be achieved by setting up the columnsStep to value larger than 1.

Specified by:
setPosition in interface TargetInterface
Parameters:
columnPosition - the cell position to set
columnStep - the step to shift for each cell on the position larger than 0
See Also:
TargetInterface.dumpCell(int, Object)

shiftPosition

public void shiftPosition(int columnsToShift)
Description copied from interface: TargetInterface
Shifts the output cell position from the current position by the specified number of cells.

Specified by:
shiftPosition in interface TargetInterface
Parameters:
columnsToShift - the number of cells to shift

shiftPosition

public void shiftPosition(int columnsToShift,
                          int columnStep)
Description copied from interface: TargetInterface
Shifts the output cell position from the current position by the specified number of cells. This method could be used to arrange the dump of values to be interlaced. This could be achieved by setting up the columnsStep to value larger than 1.

Specified by:
shiftPosition in interface TargetInterface
Parameters:
columnsToShift - the number of cells to shift
columnStep - the step to shift for each cell on the position larger than 0
